root: ^It is an honor to meet with you.
^You say that like you're happy to be here.
^Not for a moment. No one ever actually wants to talk with us.
^Yes, but I summoned you, that means you had to come.
^Just because you summon someone does not mean they are required to attend.
^I am not against you, I was summoned and agreed to come. What is it you wish to discuss?

^You see, our merchants have always sold their goods within the house. Naturally, we have taxed their sales to earn our fair share of the money. However, these merchants have begun to sell their goods to other houses?
^Is that so bad? That just means there's more money flowing into your house.
^That would be ideal. However, they are not paying taxes on sales outside the house.
^The issue is that those merchants are growing rich, yet we are not seeing any of that money.
^So what do you want from me?
^We want you to find everyone who purchased these goods and have them brought to the constables.

s: ^You could expand your laws on taxes.

NOWAY: ^We are not mad, we are rational.
^Hardly. I am not going to have anyone arrested for legally spending their money. Your greed blinds you. You are wealthy enough. Good day!
YOUCOULDEXPANDYOURLAWSONTAXES: ^I will not arrest anyone for legally spending their money, even if you don't benefit from it.
^Hold on, Kelxcex. I will not arrest anyone. However, you could expand your laws on taxes to mandate all sales charge tax, even outside the house.
^Yeah, surprisingly simple. You couldn't figure that out on your own?
